I am quite familiar with this. 

If you do as Stack suggests, adding your o=
wn 'modules/processors.options' to
your jar file, your processors.options f=
ile will in effect be _appended_ to
the standard one. There is no need to r=
epeat what is in the default options
file. Just add your own lines.

See: h=
ttp://vefsofnun.bok.hi.is/deduplicator/ for an example of a project
that ta=
kes advantage of this.

Best,
Kris

> >
> > Hi

rix through my application . I have placed

h.

> processor.options file in the heritrix.jar.

 a way to override its options file 
> with our own?

> I wonder what=
 would happen if you added your own modules file 
> and had it appear later=
 on the CLASSPATH (For example, make a 
> jar that has your new module in i=
t and include in it a file 
> at 'modules/processor.options', etc.)? It loo=
ks like we try 
> to do the right thing and read all found on the CLASSPATH=
 and 
> it looks like the last module read will prevail. See 
> http://craw=
ler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/admin/Craw
> lJobHandler.html#1165=
.

Handler.html#1165.>

> Let us know if it works or not.
